com:
currently playing Daggerfall since its free on steam and im having an ABSOLUTE blast i didnt have in years and cant wait to continue playing after work. listen. you've never had so much freedom in a videogame before in everything you want to do and every single TES that came after it is just a shameful wish bootleg compared to this masterpiece.
you can climb on every single fucking wall in this game if your climbing skill is high enough. you have tons of dialogue options and youre even able to set your tone (polite, blunt or neutral). you can wear a cloak over your armor if you fucking feel like it. the map is the size of the fucking UK and still one of the biggest maps in videogames to explore ever. adventuring from one town to another would take literal(!) days if you dont fast travel. talking about fast travel: you can even decide on the specifics about your fast travel. are you cautious or stoic, resting at camps or inns? no questmarkers btw. just quest texts and your own capabilites of nailing down the target. this game is fucking amazing and i WISH we had some kind of spiritual successor to it.
only gripe so far is the default keybinding with even turning around your head as button presses instead of using your mouse but you can easily change that in the options.

play it if you havent. right now. fuck morrowind dude.

name: Anonymous
sub: Is it just me, or is this game kind of shit?
com:
I, like many others, was enticed into playing this game after witnessing the plethora of circlejerks surrounding it on /v/. I went into the experience excited, but that excitement wore off pretty quickly.

1) Combat is braindead beyond belief. My impressions were that this was a "hardcore" RPG that required brains to play. You literally just left-click on enemies until they die... If you run low on health, you just open up your inventory, chug some potions, then go back to left-clicking. Your character has 3 attacks that he can do, but there's never any reason not to just use the most damaging one.

2) Little to no build variety. Regardless of how you create your character, you still fall into the lame old 3-build template that all other RPGs fall into. You either end up hitting something with a melee weapon, throwing magic at something or sneaking around something. There is no deviation from this whatsoever.

3) Just a boring world. Everything is too pristine looking and tidy. I understand that it's a mystical fantasy land... but it's completely lacking in any of the gritty human elements which would make the world seem believable and relatable. That's why I love FromSoft games, which always seem to expertly blend those two themes together. Morrowind is so cookie-cutter in its presentation that it's almost sickening.

4) Quests are boring. "Go here, kill these creatures. Go there, collect 5 mushrooms. Go here, talk with boring NPC about nonsensical lore". Just boring.

Anyone else feel this way?

name: Anonymous
com:
Now that it's December and the TGA has come and passed, what is /v/'s personal game of the year?

The more open-ended level design is a stark contrast from it's predecessors -- and yet a natural evolution for the series. With this change comes a level of freedom way beyond what is usually expected from these games, being able to tackle difficult areas or sidequests in any way you like for a more freeform risk/reward system than the ramping linearity of previous titles. Gameplay is also positively impacted, pacing is fast and rapid as you go from one encounter to the next, and the next. You can be heading towards the quest marker but then you accidentally steer off to a place of interest instead, and get rewarded with good or rare loot.

The experience is completely different from what you would expect going into it, and is a extremely pleasant surprise of the year. Can't wait for Pokemon Legends 2. Pic unrelated

This game is just fun. It is on the rails and there is little you can do outside of following the main path but what it does, it does well.
The combat feels so satisfying despite not being that deep. The environments look great and honestly this is the second best 7/10 game I've played this year, the first being Stranger of Paradise.
My only issue with the game, one that actually annoys me a lot is that there are way too many cutscenes.

Have you guys tried the game yet? What did you think about it?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
I played it a couple weeks ago and it was ok to good, but not great.
Some of my gripes are that some/a lot of the weapons are superfluous, you can't backtrack on a stage which means missing a lot of collectibles if you go through the main path by mistake and that the worldbuilding isn't that great.
Im a sucker for supernatural on different time pieces and not only medieval shit but this one was weak, it starts with the vampires then it just gives random monsters to the vampires for the sake of enemy variation that make no sense on the lore.
Not a fan of the Senator, stupidly written character.
Also the weird as fuck difficulty increase at one point in the game, it gets a massive difficulty spike when you get to bats in the belfry mission.
So yeah an aggresive 7/10 imo, i would recommend it in a sale but would be wary at full price.
